text: A man standing on a lift that is descending does not feel any weight because

options.A: the inside of the lift is air tight
options.C: the lift's acceleration is same as acceleration due to gravity
options.D: there is no gravitational pull on the man in the lift

explanation:
The resultant force acting on the man is given by w = mg - RMg - mg = 0The man feels weightless because the reaction, R is equal to the weight mg
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two balls X and Y weighing 5 g and 50 kg respectively were thrown up vertically at the same time with a velocity of 100 ms1 .How will their positions be one second later?

options.A: X and Y will be 500 m from each other
options.B: Y will be 500 m ahead of X
options.C: X will be 500 m ahead of Y
options.D: X and Y both be 500 m from the point of throw

explanation:
v2 = U2 - 2G s0 = 1002 - 2 x 10 x s = 10000 - 20ss = (10000)/20 = 500mWhich is independent of mass.the two bodies where acted upon by the same retarding force of gravity which is independent of mass of the body; therefore both will be 500 m from the point of throw.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

increase in volume, \(\Delta\)V = V x 3\(\alpha\) x \(\Delta \theta\)= 3 x 2.0 X 10\(^{-5}\) x 40 x (90 - 30)= 6 x 10\(^{-5}\) x 40 x 600.144 cm\(^3\)∴ No correct option

text:
A copper wire was subjected to a tensile stress of 7.7 x 10\(^7\). Calculate the strain of the wire.
[Young modules = 1.1 x 10\(^11\) Nm\(^{-2}\)]
explanation:
Young modules = \( \frac{\text{Tensile stress}}{\text{Tensile strain}}\)= \( 1.1 \times 10^11 = \frac{7.7 \times 10^7}{\text{Tensile Strain}} \)∴ Tensile strain = \( \frac{7.7 \times 10^7}{1.1 \times 10^{11}} \)= \( 7.0 \times 10^{7-11}= 7.0 \times 10^{-4} \)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Steam burn is more severe than that of boiling water because

options.A: steam burn is independent of relative humidity
options.B: steam possesses greater heat energy per unit mass
options.C: water boils at a higher temperature
options.D: steam burn is dependent on relative humidity

explanation:
The specific latent heat of vaporization of steam is 2.1 x 106JKg-1while the energy required to raise the temperature of a unit mass of water from 0°c to 100°c = C x Dt = 4200 x 100 = 420000 = 4.2 x 105 JKg-1∴ steam possesses greater heat energy per unit mass
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When a red rose flower is observed in blue light, what colour does the observer see?
explanation:
The colour which an object presents to the eye is the colour of light it reflects. Red rose flower will therefore absorb any other colour and reflect red. Therefore when viewed in blue light, it has no colur to reflect and will therefore appear black. Although mixture of red light and blue light = magenta .

text: A certain far - sighted person cannot see object that are closer to the eye than 50 cm clearly. Determine the power of the converging lens which will enable him to see at 25 cm
explanation:
\(\frac{1}{\text{f}}\) = \(\frac{1}{\text{u}}\) + \(\frac{1}{\text{v}}\)
\(\frac{1}{\text{f}}\) = \(\frac{1}{25}\) + \(\frac{1}{-50}\)
u = 25cm, v = - 50cm
\(\frac{1}{\text{f}}\) = \(\frac{1}{u}\) - \(\frac{1}{50}\) = \(\frac{2 - 1}{50}\)
f = 50cm
P = \(\frac{1}{\text{f}}\)  = \(\frac{1}{50}\)  = 0.02cm. ( in dioptres = 2D)
1D = 1m\(^{-1}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two inductors of inductance 4 II and 8 II are arrange in series and a current of 10 A is passed through them. What is the energy stored in them?
explanation:
Inductance (L) in series: 4 + 8 = 12
Therefore Energy stored =
W = \(\frac{1}{2} LI^2\)
= \(\frac{1}{2} \times 12 \times 10^2\)
= 600J

text: A length of wire has a frequency of 225Hz when stretched by a force of 225N. If the force increased to 324N, what is the new frequency of vibration?
explanation:
f1 = 225Hz, T1 = 225Nf2 = ? T2 = 324NBut f ∝ √T => f = K√T=> K = f/√T∴ f1/√T1 = f2/√T2225/√225 = f2/√324
f2 =225√324√225
f2 = 270Hz

text: Two resistors 5Ω and 10Ω are arranged first in series and later in parallel to a 24V source, the ratio of total power dissipated in the series and parallel arrangements respectively is
explanation:
Power in Series ArrangementTotal Resistance (R_series): R\(_{series}\)  = R\(_1\) + R\(_2\)  = 5Ω + 10Ω = 15Ω
Total Power (P_series): P = \(\frac{V^2}{\text{R}}\) = \(\frac{24^2}{15}\) = 38.4W
Power in parallel Arrangement
Total Resistance(R\(_{parallel}\)): R\(_{parallel}\) = \(\frac{R_1 \times R_2}{R_1 + R_2}\) = \(\frac{5 \times 10}{5 + 10}\) = 3.33
Total Power(P_{parallel}\): P =  \(\frac{V^2}{\text{R}}\) = \(\frac{24^2}{3.33}\) = 172.8W
Ratio of Powers
Power ratio =   \(\frac{\text{Pseries}}{\text{Pparallel}}\) = \(\frac{38.4}{172.8}\) = \(\frac{1}{4.5}\) = \(\frac{2}{9}\)
Therefore, there is no correct answer.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
